# Implementation Plan: Resume Web App

**Branch**: `001-resume-webapp` | **Date**: 2025-12-03 | **Spec**: `specs/001-resume-webapp/spec.md`
**Input**: Feature specification from `specs/001-resume-webapp/spec.md`

**Note**: This plan is generated by the `/speckit.plan` command workflow.

## Summary

Build a bilingual (FR/EN), static-first resume web app with vanilla HTML/CSS/JavaScript. Core features: resume sections (About with optional profile photo, Experience, Skills organized by category, Education, Contact, Social), language switcher, Dark/Light theme toggle, client-side PDF export, and a Projects showcase section for future portfolio expansion. Application architecture prioritizes zero server dependencies, manual HTML/CSS/JS customization, and privacy-first design (no trackers, no analytics by default).

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: HTML5 + CSS3 + JavaScript (ES2020+)  
**Primary Dependencies**: 
  - **Build tool option A**: Vite (modern, fast bundler; supports static export)
  - **Build tool option B**: Jekyll (static site generator; GitHub Pages native)
  - **Build tool option C**: Angular (full SPA framework; opt-in complexity for advanced features)
  - All options allow full source code customization and no forced frameworks.
  - **Optional libraries**: html2pdf or jsPDF for client-side PDF generation; no server dependency.

**Storage**: Client-side localStorage for preferences (theme, language); no backend database required; resume data baked into HTML/CSS/JS or loaded from user-editable template literals.  
**Testing**: Browser DevTools, Jest (if using build tool with it), accessibility audits (a11y), manual QA on desktop/mobile.  
**Target Platform**: Modern web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge); static hosting (GitHub Pages, Vercel, Netlify); responsive mobile-first design.  
**Project Type**: Single-page static web app (SPA or SSG depending on build tool).  
**Performance Goals**: <2s load time for above-the-fold content (Lighthouse target: 90+); instant theme/language switch (<1s perceived latency).  
**Constraints**: No server-side logic; all interactive features client-side; resume content must not be preloaded from external JSON/YAML files (data embedded or templated in source); zero third-party trackers by default.  
**Scale/Scope**: Single-page portfolio (1 main resume + Projects section); support for future game/project portfolio additions; estimated ~200-400 LOC baseline + content.

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

✅ **Minimalism & Accessibility**: Static HTML/CSS/JS is inherently minimal; WCAG AA compliance in scope (SC-006); keyboard navigation + semantic HTML required.  
✅ **Static-First & Single-Page**: Deployment target: GitHub Pages/Vercel/Netlify (static-only); no server required; satisfies WebResume Constitution Principle 2.  
✅ **Privacy & Data Minimization**: No trackers, no analytics, no personal data collection by default; localStorage-only for user preferences; satisfies Principle 3.  
✅ **Maintainability & Simplicity**: Vanilla HTML/CSS/JS chosen; optional light build tools (Vite/Jekyll/Angular); structure clear and editable; satisfies Principle 4.  
✅ **Performance & SEO**: Optimized assets, semantic HTML, meta tags, structured data; static site inherently fast; satisfies Principle 5.  

**Gate Status**: ✅ PASS — All constitution principles aligned.

specs/[###-feature]/

### Source Code (static site)

```text
webresume/
├── www/
│   ├── index.html                # Main resume page (semantic HTML)
│   └── assets/
│       ├── styles/
│       │   ├── main.css          # Core styles
│       │   ├── theme.css         # Dark/Light mode CSS variables
│       │   └── print.css         # PDF-optimized print styles
│       ├── scripts/
│       │   ├── main.js           # Core app (language, theme, PDF export)
│       │   ├── resume-data.js    # Embedded resume content (FR/EN)
│       │   └── pdf-export.js     # Client-side PDF generation
│       └── images/               # Photos, logos, icons (optimized)
├── [BUILD_TOOL_OPTIONAL]/        # Build config (vite.config.js, _config.yml, angular.json)
├── public/                       # Static assets (if using build tool)
└── dist/                         # Build output (generated)
```

**Structure Decision**: 
- Deployed as **single static page** (Option 1 + web conventions).
- **Resume data** (FR/EN content) stored in `www/assets/scripts/resume-data.js` as JavaScript object literals or baked into the `www/index.html` template; **NO external JSON/YAML files** per user constraint.
- **Build tool optional**: Project is viable as pure HTML/CSS/JS; Vite/Jekyll/Angular configs provided for optional automation.
- **Assets organized**: Styles, scripts, images in logical `assets/` subdirs for clarity and easy customization.
